description._content: Title: Florencio Garza [condemned murderer] Creator: Unknown Date: 1866 Part Of: Lawrence T. Jones III Texas photography collection Description: Florencio Garza was one of three Cortinistas who was convicted of murder and legally hanged June 22, 1866, in Brownsville, Texas, along with two other convicted mates, Juan Vela and Vicente Garcia, on the same gallows. Garza rode with the legendary Mexican general and war lord Juan N. Cortina. His murder conviction came as a result of Cortina's 1859 cross border raid on Brownsville, Texas. The photographer was likely to be Louis de Planque or R. H. Wallis. Physical Description: 1 photographic print on carte de visite mount; 10 x 6 cm. Form/Genre: Cartes de visite; Photographs; Portrait photographs File: federal_army-1-10c.tif Rights: Please cite Southern Methodist University, Central University Libraries, DeGolyer Library when using this image file. A high-quality version of this file may be obtained for a fee by contacting degolyer@smu.edu. For more information, see: digitalcollections.smu.edu/u?/jtx,268 View Lawrence T. Jones III Texas Photographs at: digitalcollections.smu.edu/all/cul/jtx/
